content.webTitle: San Marino's international playing record makes grim reading

fields.headline: San Marino's international playing record makes grim reading
fields.bodyText: OVERALL RECORD P115 W1 D3 L111 GF16 GA465 WORLD RANKING 0 San Marino are joint last Fifa's standings, in 207th place with Bhutan and the Turks & Caicos Islands. Their highest ranking is 118, achieved in September 1993. FIRST MATCH A 4-0 home defeat to Switzerland in a Euro 92 qualifier in November 1990. They had played unofficial matches since 1986, the first of which was against a Canadian Olympic team. SOLE WIN Yes, there has been one: a friendly at home to Liechtenstein in 2004. Andy Selva scored in a 1-0 triumph. HEAVIEST DEFEAT Germany won a Euro 2008 qualifier 13-0 in September 2006 before a record Stadio Olimpico crowd of 5,019. RECORD GOALSCORER Andy Selva, San Marino's lone pro, has scored eight in 57 internationals. IN NUMBERS 39 Goals scored by Holland against San Marino in six games, a record. 736 People who turned up to watch them play Moldova in October.
